TRINIUMCB.ToggleMidiRoll: Toggle MidiQOL Auto Roll + Fast Forward D20s
TRINIUMCB.PrivacyButtonVisibilityHint: Select who can see the privacy buttons.
TRINIUMCB.EnablePrivacyButtonsHint: Enable or disable the roll privacy buttons.
TRINIUMCB.MidiButtonVisibilityHint: Select who can see the MidiQOL buttons.
TRINIUMCB.EnableMidiButtonsHint: Enable or disable the Midi QOL buttons.
TRINIUMCB.EnablePollingHint: Enable or disable polling to autoupdate MidiQOL button states when relative Midi keybindings are held down.
TRINIUMCB.PollingRateHint: Set the polling rate for checking MidiQOL button states (in milliseconds).
TRINIUMCB.EnableCombatTrackerButtonsHint: Enable or disable the combat tracker buttons.
TRINIUMCB.CombatTrackerButtonVisibilityHint: Select who can see the combat tracker buttons.
TRINIUMCB.OverrideDnD5eCheckHint: By default, the combat tracker is only loaded when the game system is DnD5e. With this override on, it loads on all systems. Things may break.
TRINIUMCB.HealthPrivacyHint: Select how much info about NPC Health players can see
TRINIUMCB.EnableCSSTweaksHint: Enable or disable custom CSS tweaks for a darker sidebar and reduced gaps.
TRINIUMCB.LogLevelHint: Set the log level for the logger.
TRINIUMCB.EndTurn: Your turn! Click here to end.
TRINIUMCB.SelectAllPlayerTokens: Select All Players. Doubleclick: All NPCs
TRINIUMCB.SelectRandomPlayerToken: Pick Random Token. None Selected: Pick Random Player
TRINIUMCB.OnlyShowTurnControlsHint: Instead of the whole tracker, only show combat controls
TRINIUMCB.StyleFoundryCombatTracker: Apply combatant styles to the Foundry Combat Tracker
TRINIUMCB.StyleFoundryCombatTrackerHint: Apply the following features also to the built-in combat tracker: Name hiding, Hidden Tokens, Disposition/Hidden/Defeated styles. May conflict with other modules.
TRINIUMCB.EnableGMScreenHint: Enable or disable the GM Screen button.
TRINIUMCB.GMScreenContentMenuHint: Edit the HTML content of the GM Screen
TRINIUMCB.NumberOfSubscreensHint: Choose how many subscreens to display (1-4)
TRINIUMCB.SubscreenWidthHint: Set the width of each subscreen (in pixels). A value above 200 is highly recommended
TRINIUMCB.GMScreenHeightHint: Set the height of the GM Screen in bottom mode (% of total screen height)
TRINIUMCB.GMScreenModeHint: Choose whether the screen expands from the left side of the screen, chat or bottom.
TRINIUMCB.GMScreenLeftMarginHint: Set the left margin of the GM Screen in bottom mode (in pixels)
TRINIUMCB.GMScreenRightMarginHint: Set the right margin of the GM Screen in bottom mode (in pixels)
TRINIUMCB.SettingsSaved: GM Screen settings have been successfully applied.
TRINIUMCB.ExpandBottomModeHint: Enable to ignore the Subscreen Width settings in Bottom Mode, expanding to fill all available horizontal space instead
TRINIUMCB.UnsupportedPageType: Trinium GM Screen does not support page type
TRINIUMCB.EditorNote: Note: The size of the preview tab is currently set to the size of Subscreen
TRINIUMCB.UnsavedChangesConfirmation: You have unsaved changes. Do you want to discard them?
